item.text: The Ephraimites said to him, “Why have you done such a thing to us? You did not summon us when you went to fight the Midianites!” They argued vehemently with him.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them, “<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="04100" class="">what</st> have I <st data-num="06213" class="">accomplished</st> compared to you? <st data-num="03808" class="">Even</st> <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim’s</st> <st data-num="05955" class="">leftover grapes</st><n id="1" /> are <st data-num="02896" class="">better</st> quality than <st data-num="044" class="">Abiezer’s</st> <st data-num="01210" class="">harvest</st>!<n id="2" />
It was to you that God handed over the Midianite generals, Oreb and Zeeb! What did I accomplish to rival that?” When he said this, they calmed down.
Now Gideon and his 300 men had crossed over the Jordan River, and even though they were exhausted, they were still chasing the Midianites.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to the <st data-num="0582" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="05523" class="">Sukkoth</st>, “<st data-num="05414 04994">Give</st><n id="1" /> some <st data-num="03603" class="">loaves</st> of <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st> to the <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> are <st data-num="07272" class="">following</st> me<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> are <st data-num="05889" class="">exhausted</st>. <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am <st data-num="07291 0310">chasing</st> <st data-num="02078" class="">Zebah</st> and <st data-num="06759" class="">Zalmunna</st>, the <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> of <st data-num="04080" class="">Midian</st>.”

The <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> of <st data-num="05523" class="">Sukkoth</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “You have not <st data-num="06258" class="">yet</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">overpowered</st> <st data-num="03709 02078">Zebah</st> and <st data-num="06759" class="">Zalmunna</st>. <st data-num="03588" class="">So why</st> should we <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st> to your <st data-num="06635" class="">army</st>?”<n id="2" />
Gideon said, “Since you will not help, after the Lord hands Zebah and Zalmunna over to me, I will thresh your skin with desert thorns and briers.”

He <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st> from <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> to <st data-num="06439" class="">Penuel</st> and <st data-num="01696 0413">made</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">the same request</st>.<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="06439" class="">Penuel</st> <st data-num="06030" class="">responded</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">the same way</st> the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="05523" class="">Sukkoth</st> <st data-num="06030" class="">had</st>.<n id="2" />
He also threatened the men of Penuel, warning, “When I return victoriously, I will tear down this tower.”
Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor with their armies. There were about 15,000 survivors from the army of the eastern peoples; 120,000 sword-wielding soldiers had been killed.

<st data-num="01439" class="">Gideon</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st> the <st data-num="01870" class="">road</st> of the <st data-num="07931 0168">nomads</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="06924" class="">east</st> of <st data-num="05025" class="">Nobah</st> and <st data-num="03011" class="">Jogbehah</st> and <st data-num="05221" class="">ambushed</st> the <st data-num="04264 01961 0983">surprised</st> <st data-num="04264" class="">army</st>.<n id="2" />
When Zebah and Zalmunna ran away, Gideon chased them and captured the two Midianite kings, Zebah and Zalmunna. He had surprised their entire army.
Gideon son of Joash returned from the battle by the pass of Heres.

He <st data-num="03920" class="">captured</st> a <st data-num="05288" class="">young man</st> from <st data-num="0582 05523">Sukkoth</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="07592" class="">interrogated</st> him. The young man <st data-num="03789" class="">wrote down</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">for</st> him the names of <st data-num="05523" class="">Sukkoth’s</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> and city <st data-num="02205" class="">leaders</st>—<st data-num="07657 07651" class="">77</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> in all.<n id="2" />

He <st data-num="0935 0413">approached</st> the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="05523" class="">Sukkoth</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st> what I have!<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02078" class="">Zebah</st> and <st data-num="06759" class="">Zalmunna</st>! You <st data-num="02778" class="">insulted</st> me, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, ‘You have not <st data-num="06258" class="">yet</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">overpowered</st> <st data-num="03709 02078">Zebah</st> and <st data-num="06759" class="">Zalmunna</st>. <st data-num="03588" class="">So why</st> should we <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st> to your <st data-num="03286" class="">exhausted</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st>?’”<n id="2" />

He <st data-num="03947" class="">seized</st> the <st data-num="02205" class="">leaders</st><n id="1" /> of the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>, along with some <st data-num="04057" class="">desert</st> <st data-num="06975" class="">thorns</st> and <st data-num="01303" class="">briers</st>; he then “<st data-num="01758" class="">threshed</st>” the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="05523" class="">Sukkoth</st> with them.<n id="2" />
He also tore down the tower of Penuel and executed the city’s men.
He said to Zebah and Zalmunna, “Describe for me the men you killed at Tabor.” They said, “They were like you. Each one looked like a king’s son.”
He said, “They were my brothers, the sons of my mother. I swear, as surely as the Lord is alive, if you had let them live, I would not kill you.”

He <st data-num="0559" class="">ordered</st> <st data-num="03500" class="">Jether</st> his <st data-num="01060" class="">firstborn son</st>, “<st data-num="06965" class="">Come on</st>!<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02026" class="">Kill</st> them!” <st data-num="03588" class="">But</st> Jether <st data-num="03372" class="">was</st> too <st data-num="03372" class="">afraid</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">to</st> <st data-num="08025" class="">draw</st> his <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> he was <st data-num="05750" class="">still</st> <st data-num="05288" class="">young</st>.

Zebah and Zalmunna said to Gideon, “Come on, you strike us, for a man is judged by his strength.” So Gideon killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and he took the crescent-shaped ornaments that were on the necks of their camels.
The men of Israel said to Gideon, “Rule over us—you, your son, and your grandson. For you have delivered us from Midian’s power.”
Gideon said to them, “I will not rule over you, nor will my son rule over you. The Lord will rule over you.”

<st data-num="01439" class="">Gideon</st> <st data-num="0559 0413">continued</st>,<n id="1" /> “I would like to <st data-num="07592 04480">make</st> one <st data-num="07596" class="">request</st>. <st data-num="0376" class="">Each</st> of you <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> me an <st data-num="05141" class="">earring</st> from the <st data-num="07998" class="">plunder</st> you have taken.”<n id="2" /> (The Midianites<n id="3" /> had <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="05141" class="">earrings</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> were <st data-num="03459" class="">Ishmaelites</st>.)

They <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “We are <st data-num="05414" class="">happy</st> to <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> you earrings.”<n id="1" /> So they<n id="2" /> <st data-num="06566" class="">spread out</st> a <st data-num="08071" class="">garment</st>, and <st data-num="0376" class="">each one</st> <st data-num="07993" class="">threw</st> an <st data-num="05141" class="">earring</st> from his <st data-num="07998" class="">plunder</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">onto it</st>.

The <st data-num="04948" class="">total weight</st> of the <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="05141 0834">earrings</st> he <st data-num="07592" class="">requested</st> came to <st data-num="0505 07651 03967">1,700</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> shekels.<n id="1" /> This was <st data-num="0905" class="">in addition</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="07720" class="">crescent-shaped ornaments</st>, <st data-num="05188" class="">jewelry</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0713" class="">purple</st> <st data-num="0899" class="">clothing</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">worn by</st> the <st data-num="04080" class="">Midianite</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st>, <st data-num="0905 04480">and</st> the <st data-num="06060 0834">necklaces</st> on the <st data-num="06677 01581">camels</st>.<n id="3" />
Gideon used all this to make an ephod, which he put in his hometown of Ophrah. All the Israelites prostituted themselves to it by worshiping it there. It became a snare to Gideon and his family.
The Israelites humiliated Midian; the Midianites’ fighting spirit was broken. The land had rest for 40 years during Gideon’s time.

Then <st data-num="03378" class="">Jerub Baal</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="03101" class="">Joash</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">home</st> and <st data-num="03427" class="">settled down</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="01439" class="">Gideon</st> <st data-num="01961 03318 03409">fathered</st> <st data-num="07657" class="">70</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="03588 01961">through</st> his <st data-num="07227" class="">many</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st>.<n id="1" />

His <st data-num="06370" class="">concubine</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> lived in <st data-num="07927" class="">Shechem</st>, <st data-num="01571 01931">also</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">gave</st> him a <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>, whom he <st data-num="07760 08034">named</st> <st data-num="040" class="">Abimelech</st>.<n id="2" />
Gideon son of Joash died at a very old age and was buried in the tomb of his father Joash located in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
After Gideon died, the Israelites again prostituted themselves to the Baals. They made Baal Berith their god.
The Israelites did not remain true to the Lord their God, who had delivered them from all the enemies who lived around them.
They did not treat the family of Jerub Baal (that is, Gideon) fairly in return for all the good he had done for Israel.
